summary: An email from September 2021 referencing a friend from around 2002 who may have information about Epstein-related activities, suggesting drunk conversations could provide leads. The sender uses the signature 'Kindness Matters'.

persons.name: Kindness Matters
persons.context: The person sending the email, referencing a friend from around 2002 who may have information and suggesting drunk conversations could be a promising lead.

events.title: Friend's visit to sender's house
events.description: A friend visited the email sender's house around 2002, and the sender suggests this friend may have information from drunk conversations.

keyFacts: The email is dated September 25, 2021, showing continued interest or investigation into Epstein-related matters years after his death.
The sender references a friend from around 2002 who may have information from 'many drunk nights and talks'.
The sender suggests calling a male contact but warns 'he may link it to me', indicating concerns about being identified.
The email signature 'Kindness Matters' suggests the sender may be using a pseudonym or motto.
The document shows attempts to gather information about potential leads related to Epstein's activities.
